byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu reported from Istanbul, and Tim Arango from Baghdad. Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London, Victor Homola from Berlin, and Patrick Boehler from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By CEYLAN YEGINSU and TIM ARANGO

abstract: Turkish government says Islamic State suicide bomber is responsible for attack in Istanbul, which left 10 tourists dead.
lead_paragraph: The Turkish government said that the Islamic State was behind the attack in the district of Sultanahmet, and that the dead were all foreign citizens.

headline.main: Istanbul Explosion Kills 10 Tourists, and ISIS Is Blamed
headline.print_headline: ISIS Blamed in Attack That Kills 10 Tourists in Istanbul

snippet: The Turkish government said that the Islamic State was behind the attack in the district of Sultanahmet, and that the dead were all foreign citizens.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
